summary: TypeScript SDK is unable to call tools when using Google as provider with MCP server due to a missing `clientArgs` property on the args object. The code references `args.clientArgs` which does not exist, causing the tool calling functionality to fail.
userImpact: Users cannot use the tool calling feature with Google provider and MCP server due to a code error that prevents argument passing.
rootCause: The code at line 59 references `args.clientArgs` which does not exist on the args object, causing a runtime error when attempting to call tools.
resolutionDetails: Issue was closed, indicating the missing clientArgs property was likely fixed in a subsequent commit.
